alert.note: Alert for Knox (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 19 at 6:56AM EST until February 20 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Kentucky... Cumberland River at Barbourville affecting Knox County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Cumberland River at Barbourville. * WHEN...From this morning to late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, Low lying roads flood. Manchester street floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 AM EST Sunday the stage was 26.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to recede to around 23.1 feet by 7 PM EST this evening and recede further to around 16.2 feet by 7 AM EST on Monday. - Action stage is 21.5 feet. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. The next statement will be issued by 4 PM EST.
